name: biomni-interspecies-gene-conversion
title: Biomni: Interspecies Gene Conversion
description: Convert ENSEMBL gene IDs between different species using BioMart homology mapping
content:
Overview

Converts ENSEMBL gene IDs between different species using BioMart homology mapping based on orthology relationships. This tool enables cross-species genomic analysis by identifying evolutionarily conserved genes, facilitating translation of findings between model organisms and humans, and enabling comparative functional genomics studies.

Input Parameters

  • gene_list_file (string): Path to JSON file containing array of ENSEMBL gene IDs from stash
  • source_species (string, required): Source species - human, mouse, rat, zebrafish, fly, worm, yeast, chicken, pig, cow, dog, macaque
  • target_species (string, required): Target species - human, mouse, rat, zebrafish, fly, worm, yeast, chicken, pig, cow, dog, macaque
  • output (string): Output directory path

Input Format

Provide a JSON file with the following structure:

{
  "gene_list_file": "/path/to/genes.json",
  "source_species": "mouse",
  "target_species": "human",
  "output": "/output/directory"
}

Where genes.json contains:

["ENSMUSG00000041147", "ENSMUSG00000028959", "ENSMUSG00000022892"]

Biological Use Case

Critical for translating research between model organisms and clinical applications. Used to identify human orthologs of mouse disease genes, convert gene lists from animal studies to human equivalents, study evolutionary conservation of pathways, and design cross-species validation experiments.

Output

Generates conversion_log.txt with mapping statistics and {source}_to_{target}_gene_conversion.csv containing source IDs, target orthologs, homology types, and confidence scores.

Category

genomics
